solution_line_template: If David has {david_shells} shells, then Mia has {mia_multiplier} *{david_shells} = <<{david_shells}*{mia_multiplier}={mia_shells}>>{mia_shells} shells.
Ava has {ava_additional_shells} more shells than Mia, so that is {mia_shells}+{ava_additional_shells} = {ava_shells} shells.
Alice has {alice_fraction} the number of shells Ava has, which is {alice_fraction}*{ava_shells} = <<{alice_fraction}*{ava_shells}={alice_shells}>>{alice_shells} shells.

The total number of shells all of them have is {david_shells}+{mia_shells}+{ava_shells}+{alice_shells} = <<{david_shells}+{mia_shells}+{ava_shells}+{alice_shells}={total_shells}>>{total_shells} shells.
